modules.description: This module offers arithmetic and mathematical operations on scalar values, including unary and binary functions like addition, trigonometric transformations, and activation functions, all parameterized over a generic numeric type. It supports numerical computations essential for tasks such as scientific simulations, machine learning model training, and engineering calculations requiring precise mathematical transformations.

Creates diagonal, upper triangular, and lower triangular matrices from input arrays, and generates identity matrices of specified size. Operates on array-like structures representing matrices. Used to construct specialized matrix forms for linear algebra computations and data transformation tasks.

Performs matrix inversion, logarithmic determinant calculation, and Cholesky decomposition on dense numerical arrays. Executes singular value, QR, and LQ decompositions, and solves Sylvester and Lyapunov equations for control theory applications. Addresses linear systems and algebraic Riccati equations with specialized solvers for numerical stability.

This module provides arithmetic and mathematical operations on scalar values of type `elt`, including addition, multiplication, trigonometric functions, and activation functions, all designed for element-wise numerical transformations. It supports precise numerical computations and is applicable in scenarios like scientific simulations, signal processing, or machine learning model activations. The consistent type signature ensures flexibility across diverse numerical workflows.

Creates identity matrices and manipulates array diagonals and triangular parts. Operates on array structures with functions to extract or set elements along diagonals, upper triangles, and lower triangles. Used for matrix initialization and structural transformations in numerical computations.

Computes matrix inverses, logarithmic determinants, and Cholesky decompositions using dense arrays. Performs singular value, QR, and LQ factorizations, and solves Sylvester and Lyapunov equations with specialized solvers. Implements linear system solutions, continuous/discrete algebraic Riccati equations, and supports various matrix types including triangular and symmetric structures.

This module offers arithmetic and mathematical operations on scalar values of type `elt`, including basic computations like addition and division, as well as trigonometric and activation functions. It supports element-wise transformations for numerical processing, enabling tasks such as scientific calculations or data normalization. The consistent unary and binary operation patterns make it suitable for applications requiring precise scalar manipulations.

Creates diagonal, upper triangular, and lower triangular matrices from input arrays, and generates identity matrices of specified size. Operates on array-like structures representing matrices. Used to construct specialized matrix forms for linear algebra computations and data transformation tasks.

Performs matrix inversion, logarithmic determinant calculation, and Cholesky decomposition on dense numerical arrays. Executes singular value, QR, and LQ decompositions, and solves matrix equations including Sylvester, Lyapunov, and discrete Lyapunov problems. Supports linear system solving and control-related computations like continuous and discrete algebraic Riccati equations.

Combines scalar arithmetic, matrix construction, and advanced linear algebra operations into a unified computational framework. Supports generic numeric types for scalar calculations, matrix creation from arrays, and decomposition methods for solving complex systems. Enables tasks such as computing matrix inverses, performing Cholesky factorizations, and solving Lyapunov equations. Facilitates scientific computing, control theory, and machine learning through precise numerical transformations and efficient linear algebra routines.

combines scalar arithmetic, matrix manipulation, and advanced linear algebra operations into a unified numerical computing framework. it handles element-wise transformations, matrix structure modifications, and complex matrix decompositions and solutions. users can perform tasks such as computing matrix inverses, extracting diagonals, applying activation functions, or solving Riccati equations. the module enables precise control over numerical workflows in fields like machine learning, physics simulations, and engineering analysis.

Provides arithmetic, matrix construction, and linear algebra operations on numerical data. Supports scalar computations, matrix creation (diagonal, triangular, identity), and advanced matrix manipulations (inversion, decomposition, solving equations). Enables tasks such as data normalization, linear system solving, and control theory computations. Offers unary and binary operations, matrix transformations, and specialized solvers for scientific and engineering applications.

combines scalar arithmetic, matrix manipulation, and advanced linear algebra into a unified numerical framework, enabling precise control over operations from element-wise transformations to complex decompositions. key data types include matrices, vectors, and scalars, with operations ranging from inversion and diagonal extraction to solving Riccati equations. users can apply activation functions, modify matrix structures, and perform numerical solutions critical to machine learning and engineering. examples include computing matrix inverses, extracting diagonal elements, and solving systems via decomposition.

Provides a unified framework for scalar arithmetic, matrix operations, and advanced linear algebra, supporting generic numeric types. Offers matrix creation from arrays, decomposition techniques, and solutions to equations like Lyapunov. Enables computation of inverses, Cholesky factorizations, and other transformations critical for scientific and machine learning applications. Supports precise numerical workflows across diverse computational tasks.

Provides numerical integration and single-step evolution for systems of ordinary differential equations using a solver module. Operates on state vectors, time specifications, and differential functions mapping state and time to derivatives. Used to compute approximate solutions to initial value problems where the rate of change depends on the current state and time.

Performs arithmetic, matrix construction, and linear algebra operations on numerical data, supporting scalar computations, matrix creation, and advanced manipulations like inversion and decomposition. It handles tasks such as data normalization, solving linear systems, and control theory calculations through unary and binary operations, transformations, and specialized solvers. Key data types include scalars and matrices, with operations ranging from basic arithmetic to complex decompositions. Examples include constructing identity matrices, solving systems of equations, and performing singular value decompositions.

Provides functions to compute a single integration step and solve initial value problems using user-defined evolution functions. Operates with custom types for state, function signatures, and output structures. Used to implement or extend numerical solvers for differential equations in scientific computing applications.

Provides solvers for stiff and non-stiff ordinary differential equations using adaptive step size control, with support for root-finding and event detection. Operates on real-valued vectors and systems of equations defined by user-provided functions. Used for simulating dynamic systems in scientific computing, such as biochemical reaction networks and mechanical system dynamics.

combines numerical operations, matrix manipulations, and differential equation solving into a cohesive system for scientific and machine learning tasks. it supports matrices, vectors, and scalars, enabling operations like inversion, decomposition, and integration. users can compute matrix inverses, solve differential equations, and perform singular value decompositions. it facilitates both low-level linear algebra and high-level numerical simulations.
